intro: Prenanthes triquetra, commonly known as three-lobed waterleaf, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its leaves are heart-shaped with three distinct lobes, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers. Prenanthes triquetra is often found in clusters along the edges of streams and ponds, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
